info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 24 at 2:51PM AKST until November 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR HAINES THROUGH MONDAY EVENING...
A weak, decaying low pressure is bringing moisture up from the south, generating snow showers for Haines, Lutak, Mud Bay continuing through Monday evening. Highest uncertainty regarding this system is the depth of the moisture profile, which will dictate heavier rates. As of 2 pm, Amounts have ranged from 2 to 6 inches, with one report of 6 inches on the Chilkat Peninsula since 10 pm Sunday. Snow showers expected to continue early this evening before starting to diminish through the overnight hours. Highest accumulations will be around Haines and Mud Bay.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches.
* WHERE...Haines, Lutak, and Mud Bay.
* WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 2 pm, 2 to 6 inches of snow has fallen across the area. Snowfall is expected to continue through early Monday evening before diminishing overnight.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING
